title: Baseline Systems and Evaluation Metrics for Spatial Semantic Segmentation of Sound Scenes
author: Binh Thien Nguyen (NTT Corporation), Masahiro Yasuda (NTT Corporation), Daiki Takeuchi (NTT Corporation), Daisuke Niizumi (NTT Corporation), Yasunori Ohishi (NTT Corporation), Noboru Harada (NTT Corporation), ..., Yasuhiro Yoshikawa (NTT Corporation)
relevance_why: This paper combines audio tagging and source separation techniques, which could inspire similar methodologies in Haohe Liu's work on audio generation and manipulation.
background: The task involves detecting and separating sound events in spatial audio mixtures, which includes processing multiple sources and their location information.
contribution: This paper introduces two baseline systems that integrate audio tagging and label-queried source separation models, achieving significant improvements in sound event extraction.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods only assessed the performance of source separation and audio tagging separately without considering label accuracy.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work proposes a novel evaluation metric that combines both the quality of separated sources and their corresponding labels, enhancing performance assessment.

key_innovation: Introduces class-aware metrics that evaluate separated sound sources and their class labels simultaneously, which is crucial for effective sound scene understanding.
real_world_impact: The methods presented can facilitate advancements in immersive audio communication technologies, leading to improved user experiences in applications such as virtual reality and teleconferencing.
limitations: No specific limitations were mentioned by the authors.

new_terms.spatial semantic segmentation: **Spatial semantic segmentation** refers to the process of identifying and isolating different sound events within a spatial audio scene, providing distinct outputs for each sound source based on their class labels.
new_terms.label-queried source separation: **Label-queried source separation** is an approach that utilizes specific labels to facilitate the separation of audio sources, ensuring accuracy in isolating the desired sounds from a mixture.
